intro: Oldenlandia rigida, commonly known as rigid oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers and opposite, linear leaves. It often grows in moist, shaded areas and can be found in forests or along stream banks. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
